meanings.definition: To equip with or automate by computers.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to computerize their inventory system for better efficiency.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to computerize their payroll processes nowadays.
meanings.sent3: I tried to computerize my morning routine, but I ended up pressing snooze too many times.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to computerize the information at lightning speed during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's goal was to computerize the data analysis to save time and reduce errors.

meanings.definition: To control, perform, or store information in a computer.
meanings.sent1: Students can easily computerize their notes for quick access during lectures.
meanings.sent2: The library decided to computerize their catalog to make searching for books easier.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally computerized my shopping list and now it's all mixed up with work files.
meanings.sent4: Her brain seemed to computerize the memories, neatly storing them for easy retrieval.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to computerize the evidence to solve the complex case.
